abstracts.cdata!:
The Structural Adjustment Loan (SAL)
            Project outcome is rated satisfactory, with a highly
            satisfactory Bank performance, which in the midst of a
            banking crisis, reacted promptly to the Government's
            request for assistance. The appropriate project design
            contributed to a highly dynamic process, with a close and
            effective supervision. The Government responded in a
            cooperative manner, with reform goals being mostly met,
            despite a certain reluctancy towards some bank
            privatizations. Sustainability is likely, considering that
            the measures implemented have strong government backing, as
            well as popular support. However, some key lessons may still
            be drawn from success, such as: 1) The effective program
            sustainability is the result of the SAL team, who
            appropriately highlighted the benefits of the reform
            program, now passed into law, regulation, and routine
            practice. Such effectiveness requires a skilled team with
            adequate resources. 2) The necessary and effective technical
            assistance, as well as donor coordination, contributed to
            the project's success, because of advanced planning
            prior to implementation. 3) Critical to the SAL success is
            the fact that it was conducted in parallel with sector
            operations, as part of an integrated country strategy, thus
            providing momentum, technical advice and critical resources.
            4) Challenging reforms may become stimulus for action,
            promoting bold actions across sectors.
